questions.question_text:
An administrator must improve the resiliency of a link by minimizing data loss within the enterprise network that has full path redundancy.

What should the administrator enable on the FortiGate devices that use BGP as dynamic routing protocol between two separate autonomous systems? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
Can only be A and C considering ibgp is for iBGP and the question states between different autonomous systems which implies eBGP is used. Route reflector client also has no significance. BFD and graceful restart are all options for reducing data loss during failovers. BFD allows for faster failure detection while graceful restart allows the HA cluster to advertise that it is going offline allowing traffic to find an alternative path preventing disruption of network traffic.

choices.D: Forward error correction in phase 2 is set to enable
choices.A: Dead peer detection is set to enable
choices.C: Both IPsec SAs are loaded on the kernel

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
ver=2 is IKEv2

dpd: mode=off (dead peer detection is disabled)

fec: egreess=0 ingress=0 (forward error correction is disabled) (also FEC is phase1 not 2)

npu_flag=00 means that both IPsec SA are loaded in the kernel
Study guide page 321

Selected Answer: BC
The answer is B (ver:2) C (npu-flag=00)

Selected Answer: BC
B and C are correct

questions.question_text:
While configuring the BGP protocol, an administrator applies the set network-import-check disable command under config network.

What will FortiGate do as a result of this command?

choices.D: FortiGate will not advertise the prefixes, if it is not in the routing table.
choices.C: FortiGate will not advertise any imported routes received from one BGP neighbor to another.
choices.A: FortiGate will advertise only the corresponding prefixes in the BGP network table to its BGP neighbor, even if it is not in the routing table.
choices.B: FortiGate will advertise all the prefixes in the BGP network table to its BGP neighbor, even if it is not in the routing table.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
7.2 Study Guide page 195
If you disable the setting in config network, only the corresponding prefixes are advertised in
the BGP network table, regardless of the active routes present in the routing table.

Selected Answer: A
7.2 Study Guide page 195
If you disable the setting in config network, only the corresponding prefixes are advertised in the BGP network table, regardless of the active routes present in the routing table.

Selected Answer: A
Answer is definitely A, if the setting is under config network only corresponding prefixes are advertised in the BGP network table regardless of active routes present in the routing table.

Selected Answer: B
Page 388 study guide. 
Fortigate doesn't advertise the prefix. You can change this behavior by disabling the network-import-check setting. After you disable the setting, Fortigate advertises all prefixes in the BGP network table, regardless of the active routes present in the routing table.

comments.content: This would be the case if it wasnt under config network, because this mentions config network its A

A - no - set auto-discovery-receiver enable - only on spokes
